trans-unit.source: Represents the primary key field or fields of a record in a data-bound control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> class is used to represent the primary key for a record in a data-bound control.
The primary key for a record can be composed of one of more fields from the data source.
Although the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> class is not a collection, it can store multiple key field values.
The key field values are populated when one of the constructors for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> class is called.
You can retrieve a key field value from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object in the following ways:

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%28System.Int32%29?displayProperty=fullName> property to retrieve a key field value at a specific index in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%28System.String%29?displayProperty=fullName> property to retrieve a key field value of a specific field.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Value%2A> property to retrieve the value of the key field at index 0 in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
This property is often used as a shortcut to retrieve the key value of a record when the primary key contains only one field.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Values%2A> property to create an <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object that can be used to iterate through the key field values.
In general, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> objects are automatically generated by data-bound controls when the control's `DataKeyNames` property is set.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> objects contain the values of the key field or fields specified in the `DataKeyNames` property.

Data-bound controls that display a single record at a time (such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>) generally store the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object for the current record displayed in the `DataKey` property of the control.

Data-bound controls that display multiple records at a time (such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>) generally store the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> objects for each record in the control in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> collection is then stored in the `DataKeys` property of the control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> class using the specified dictionary of key field values.
Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> class using the specified dictionary of key field values.

The field values contained in the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object passed in for the `keyTable` parameter are used to populate the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
This version of the constructor does not allow you to specify a list of field names in advance for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
Because the field names are not specified in advance, both the field names and values are stored in view state.
To specify a list of field names in advance, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.%23ctor%28System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary%2CSystem.String%5B%5D%29> constructor.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> that contains the key field values.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> class using the specified dictionary of key field values and array of field names.
Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> class using the specified dictionary of key field values and array of field names.

The field values contained in the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object passed in for the `keyTable` parameter are used to populate the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
This constructor also allows you to specify a list of the key field names for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object in advance through the `keyNames` parameter.
Because the field names are specified in advance, only the key field values are stored in view state when this constructor is used.
The key field values.
An array of strings that contain the names of the key fields.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> array is equal to the current data key.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object to compare to the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref>.
object.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property is used to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object is tracking its view-state changes.
This property is used primarily by control developers.
`true` to indicate that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the value of the key field at the specified index from a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%28System.Int32%29> property to retrieve the value of the key field at the specified index in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
As an alternative, you can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%28System.String%29> property to retrieve a key field value by field name.
The zero-based index at which to retrieve the key field value.
The value of the key field at the specified index.
Gets the value of the key field with the specified field name from a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%28System.String%29> property to retrieve the value of the specified key field from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
As an alternative, you can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%28System.Int32%29> property to retrieve a key field value by index.
The name of the key field for which to retrieve the key field value.
The value of the key field with the specified field name.
Loads the previously saved view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.LoadViewState%2A> method is used to load the previously saved view state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
An object that represents the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref>.
state is not `null` and cannot be resolved to a valid .
Saves the current view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.SaveViewState%2A> method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> class to save the state of the object.
This method is used primarily by control developers.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the saved state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
Marks the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving view-state changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
This method is overridden to mark the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object as part of the object's view state.
Gets the value of the key field at index 0 in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.

Instead of using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Item%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Values%2A> property to retrieve a key field value from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Value%2A> property as a shortcut to determine the value of the key field at index 0 in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
This property is commonly used to determine the key field value of a record when the record has only one key field.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object does not contain any key fields, `null` is returned.
The value of the key field at index 0 in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref>.
Gets an <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> object that contains every key field in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.Values%2A> property to retrieve an <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object that contains every key field in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
The <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object is often used to iterate through the key fields of a record.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> that contains every key field in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23IsTrackingViewState%2A> property is used to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object is tracking its view-state changes.
`true` to indicate that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, `false`.
Loads the previously saved view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23LoadViewState%2A> method is used to load the previously saved view state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref>.
Saves the current view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23SaveViewState%2A> method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> class to save the state of the object.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the saved state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
Marks the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving view-state changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object.
This method is overridden to mark the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object as part of the object's view state.
